subject: Travel
title: The Hub-and-Spoke System
description: A fast breakdown of The Hub-and-Spoke System for builders.

hook.text: Most flights don't go directly where you want. They funnel through giant hub airports first.

buildup.text: After deregulation in 1978, airlines reorganized around hub cities to cut costs and fill more seats.

discovery.text: Atlanta became the world's busiest airport because Delta turned it into the ultimate hub.

twist.text: Budget carriers like Southwest rejected hubs entirely. They fly point-to-point and skip the system.

climax.text: Today both models coexist. Legacy airlines use hubs; budget carriers connect cities directly.

punchline.text: Your layover exists because of a 1978 law.

quiz.question: What is the world's busiest airport by passenger traffic?
